means: 教育( educate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: People live longer nowadays, and they are better educated.
sentence.Network_cn: 当今，人们越来越长寿，受教育程度也提高了。

sentence.Network_en: She was educated — after a fashion — at home.
sentence.Network_cn: 她算得上是受过教育——家庭教育。

sentence.Network_en: She was privately educated at schools in Ireland and Paris.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在爱尔兰和巴黎的学校接受过私立教育。

entry.def: Someone who is educated has a high standard of learning.

example.ex: He is an educated, amiable and decent man.
example.tran: 他是个有教养、和蔼可亲的正人君子。

means.word_mean: 1. possessing an education (especially having more than average knowledge)
2. having or based on relevant experience;
3. adequately educated in the use of numerical terms and concepts especially in arithmetical operations

auth_sentence.content: The family moved to London where Shackleton was educated.
auth_sentence.res_content: The family moved to London where Shackleton was educated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The family moved to London where Shackleton was educated.

auth_sentence.content: Brunel was educated both in England and in France.
auth_sentence.res_content: Brunel was educated both in England and in France.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Brunel was educated both in England and in France.

auth_sentence.content: This means experts have to make an educated guess.
auth_sentence.res_content: This means experts have to make an educated guess.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This means experts have to make an educated guess.

Sentence.sentence: People should be educated not to eat too much.
The publisher, fearful of being cheated, forced her to submit to his scholarly examination by a board of educated men, including the colonial governor.
The board of judges questioned Wheatley extensively and ruled that she was educated enough to have written the book
She was the first educated slave of John Whitley's.

means.word_mean: 有教育的,受(某种形式的)教育的;受过良好训练的,熟练的

sentences.en: Command of the mother tongue is the most distinguishing mark of an educated man or woman.
sentences.cn: 运用本国语言的能力是受过教育的人最明显的标志。

sentences.en: He was educated at a very good school.
sentences.cn: 他在一所极好的学校受教育。

sentences.en: He was educated for the law.

means.word_mean: 有把握的猜测；基于事实(或可靠消息)作出的估计

sentences.en: I can’t tell you exactly how much the building work will cost, but I can make an educated guess.
sentences.cn: 虽然我没法告诉你具体的修建费用，但是我可以估计个八九不离十。
